Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Duane Sleet, Pastor, First Baptist Church of Far Rockaway, 1510 Redfern Avenue, Far Rockaway, NY 11691-3898.  

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Sanders.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Duane Sleet, Pastor, First Baptist Church of Far Rockaway, 1510 Redfern Avenue, Far Rockaway, N.Y. 11691-3898..


At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Comrie) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 13, 2012 be adopted as printed by Council Member Levin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Levin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 13, 2012 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Withdrawing the plan it submitted to the Council on 11/19/12 (M 945), which divides NYC into 51 districts for the election of members of the NYC Council.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the Fifth Avenue Association, Bryant Park, Downtown-Lower Manhattan, Kings Highway, 47th Street, North Flatbush Avenue and Madison/23rd/Flatiron/Chelsea Business Improvement Districts, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended annually in seven business improvement districts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the President of the United States to reach an agreement on debt reduction before the end of the year that would avert short-term economic damage.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Dickens) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Dickens) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following Council Members formally voted against this item:  Council Members Halloran, Ignizio, and Oddo.


The following Council Member formally abstained to vote on this item:  Council Member Vallone, Jr..



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Congress and the President to reach an agreement on debt reduction before the end of the year that would avert short-term economic damage.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to city agencies’ collection of demographic data.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: City agencies’ collection of demographic data.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the state and federal governments to amend their official forms and databases to accommodate multiracial identification in all instances where racial identification is required.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: State and federal governments to amend their official forms and databases to accommodate multiracial identification in all instances where racial identification is required.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 2169/S.1195, also known as the POWER Act, which would allow victims of any federal, state, or local labor law violations with regard to wages and hours, labor relations, family and medical leave, occupational health and safety, and discrimination to apply for lawful status if they have suffered substantial mental or physical abuse as a result of the violation, have been helpful or are likely to be helpful in the investigation of the violation, and will suffer extreme hardship if removed from the United States.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: The Power Act (H.R. 2169/S.1195)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to amend the Vehicle and Traffic Law to eliminate the penalty of incarceration for individuals convicted of operating a motor vehicle with a suspended license when such license was suspended solely due to failing to respond to a summons.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the penalty of incarceration for individuals convicted of operating a motor vehicle with a suspended license when such license was suspended solely due to failing to respond to a summons.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving certain permit and inspection fees for the demolition, alteration, rebuilding or repair of certain buildings and systems damaged by the severe storm that occurred on October 29 and 30, 2012, commonly referred to as “Hurricane Sandy.”
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Waiving certain permit and inspection fees for the demolition, alteration, rebuilding or repair of certain buildings and systems damaged by the severe storm that occurred on October 29 and 30, 2012, commonly referred to as “Hurricane Sandy”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, the Department of Transportation, and Cemusa to work together to install bus arrival time displays in bus shelters using data from the MTA’s Bus Time technology.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Install bus arrival time displays in bus shelters using data from the MTA’s Bus Time technology.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the President of the United States to reach an agreement on debt reduction before the end of the year that would avert short-term economic damage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Congress and the President to reach an agreement on debt reduction before the end of the year that would avert short-term economic damage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) to rate bus lines on the basis of a letter grading system of A to F, utilizing criteria such as cleanliness, on-time arrival, and availability of seats.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to rate bus lines on the basis of a letter grading system of A to F.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the campaign finance board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Campaign Finance Board

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to extension of the due date for payment of the installment of real property tax that is ordinarily due and payable on January 1, 2013 for real property determined to be damaged and unsafe to enter or occupy as a result of the severe storm that occurred on October twenty-ninth and thirtieth, two thousand twelve.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Sandy Real Property Tax Extension

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code and the building code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring a sign at inaccessible building entrances indicating that a portable ramp is available when such a ramp exists.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring a sign at inaccessible building entrances indicating that a portable ramp is available when such a ramp exists.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities, and to repeal chapter 2 of title 9 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the department of juvenile justice.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MatterName: Requiring the administration for children’s services to publish demographic data and incident reports on youth detained and placed in its juvenile facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, a  bill  that would allow bankruptcy courts to impose a reorganization plan, known as a “cramdown,” on mortgage debts, which would encourage mortgage companies to modify loans and provide a back-up plan for borrowers who cannot get the mortgage assistance they need.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass, and the President to sign, a  bill  that would allow bankruptcy courts to impose a reorganization plan, known as a “cramdown,” on mortgage debts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, the Senate to introduce and pass companion legislation and the Governor to sign A.9700, which amends the Social Services Law by clarifying that public assistance applicants and recipients are not subject to ineligibility provisions for child care related compliance issues when a parent is unable to find suitable child care.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amends the Social Services Law by clarifying that public assistance applicants and recipients are not subject to ineligibility provisions for child care related compliance issues when a parent is unable to find suitable child care. (A.9700)

Items.Title: Resolution in support of A.2957 and S.1326, which would amend the social service law in relation to considering the opinion of a public assistance applicant’s health care practitioner when determining if an applicant has work limitations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Considering the opinion of a public assistance applicant’s health care practitioner when determining if an applicant has work limitations. (A.2957/S.1326)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).
There remains a vacancy in the Council pending the swearing-in of the winner of the Special Election held on November 6, 2012 in the 12th Council District (The Bronx).

At this point, the Majority Leader (Council Member Rivera) assumed the podium as Acting Speaker for this Meeting upon the departure of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn).
At a certain point before the voice-vote Resolutions segment of this Meeting, Council Member Dickens assumed the chair as the President Pro Tempore for the remainder of these proceedings.
